message: When we get back to Glitter, Koujaku carries me all the way upstairs and puts me into bed.

name: 紅雀
message: "Can you at least get your clothes off? Take off everything that's dirty."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Yeah."
I take off my dirty jacket and hand it to Koujaku before crawling under the covers.
It's like the whole day has caught up with me at once. I sink into the mattress and let out a long sigh.

name: 紅雀
message: "Tired?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Yeah..."

name: 紅雀
message: "How you feeling now?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Better than I was."

name: 紅雀
message: "Good. Here's Ren."
Koujaku puts Ren on the bed. He curls up in a ball beside me.
I stroke his blue fur, letting the sensation calm me.
Koujaku leaves the room for a moment. When he returns, he sets something on the nightstand.
A glass of water.

name: 紅雀
message: "Drink this and get some sleep."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Thanks... for everything."

name: 紅雀
message: "It's nothing, man. Need anything else?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "I'm fine."

name: 紅雀
message: "Cool."
And that's the end of the conversation.
Koujaku falls silent, staring at his shoes.
I know why.

He and I are thinking about the same thing.
About what happened at the club.
After a while, Koujaku lifts his head, like he's made some kind of decision.

name: 紅雀
message: "...Aoba. Can I ask you something?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Yeah?"

name: 紅雀
message: "What were you doing there?"
My mouth snaps shut. I don't know what to say.
Koujaku looks at me, waiting.
I have to say something, but as I search for the words, another thought rears its head.
Should I ask about what's been weighing on me this whole time?
I get the feeling that I should probably stay silent... but I do still have some doubts about his actions. Wouldn't it be better to just come out and ask him?
Steeling my resolve, I open my mouth to speak.

name: 蒼葉
message: "What about you? What were you doing there?"
He looks a little surprised by the question.

name: 紅雀
message: "What was I doing there? Wait, do you even know what that place is?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "No... I just happened to see you go in."
...while I was stalking you.

name: 紅雀
message: "So you followed me? How'd you even get in?"
Koujaku narrows his eyes. I feel sweat dripping down my back.

name: 蒼葉
message: "I was trying to get your attention, but they stopped me at the entrance. Then this guy came and helped me out, and―"

name: 紅雀
message: "Helped you out?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Yeah. He was wearing a kimono just like you. He seemed like a regular."

name: 紅雀
message: "...A kimono?"
Koujaku's eyebrow twitches.

name: 紅雀
message: "He was wearing a kimono?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Uh, yeah?"

name: 紅雀
message: "Remember anything else about him?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Uh, why?"
Koujaku jerks, then shakes his head. He seems taken aback by the question.

name: 紅雀
message: "Nothing... Just thought it might've been someone I know."
...He's acting weird again.
He was like this last night, too. I know he's hiding something.

name: 蒼葉
message: "...He had short hair and a blue kimono and a really, like, laid-back attitude... and a tattoo on his neck, too."

name: 紅雀
message: "What did it look like?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Not quite a dragon... Maybe a seahorse? Something like that."
This time, Koujaku's face visibly tenses. "Grim" is the only word I can think of to describe his expression.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Do you know him?"

name: 紅雀
message: "...Aoba. Don't ever go there again."
Where did that come from?
I feel my anxiety building again.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Why not?"

name: 紅雀
message: "Look, it doesn't matter. Just stay away."

name: 蒼葉
message: "What the hell? Just because of some guy in a blue kimono?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Besides, I think you owe me an explanation first."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Like how you left without a word this morning. Did you think I wouldn't notice?"

name: 紅雀
message: "So you did follow me."

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Look, I'm sorry for lying. But you were acting so weird, I thought maybe I should just pretend I didn't see anything."

name: 蒼葉
message: "And, I mean, maybe you were trying to be considerate, but given why we're here, I'd rather you just be upfront about it..."

name: 紅雀
message: "It's not like that!"
Koujaku's tone is forceful, and his expression seems haunted somehow.

name: 紅雀
message: "...But that's all I can say right now. Sorry."
He turns away.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Hey! Wait!"
But it's no use.
After the door shuts behind Koujaku, I stare at it for a while in silence.
He really is hiding something, and he has no intention of telling me about it.
That's what this means.
He's shutting me out.
I bury my face in my pillow and let out a deep sigh.
Frustration burns in my chest, together with guilt.
I've known Koujaku for so long. I always figured we just got each other.
But right now, I don't get Koujaku at all.
And I don't know what to do about that.
What is he hiding from me?
"Don't ever go there again."
Was he telling me to keep my nose out of his business?
What the hell is going on at that club? And why is he shutting me out?

name: 蒼葉
message: "I don't get it..."
I cover my eyes with my hands and sigh again.
In all the time I've been friends with Koujaku, I've never felt this way before.
Maybe it's arrogant of me to think I know him that well.
I mean... how does Koujaku really feel about me?
...It's like I'm wandering through a thick fog. I lie there, questions gnawing at my brain, but answers never come.
